title: Virtual Education Design and Challenges: E-Learning Design Based on Motivation Theories and Learning Theories

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A course focused on designing motivational and effective online learning methodologies for learners needing rapid adaptation to virtual education environments post-COVID-19 pandemic

learning_goals: Learners can explain key motivation theories (e.g., self-determination theory, ARCS model) applicable in virtual educational environments.
Learners can formulate strategies using constructivist and cognitivist learning theories when designing e-learning content for social studies.
Learners can analyze key challenges (e.g., low engagement, insufficient interaction) in LMS-based virtual education design and propose solutions.

resources: E-Books on Motivation Theory and Learning Theory

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
